block.p: Amber Ruth Kohl, the daughter of Sharon R. Constantinidis of Columbus, Ohio, and William A. Kohl of Aguanga, Calif., was married yesterday to Jeremy Foreman Hultin, a son of Jill and Jerry Hultin of Alexandria, Va. The Rev. Dr. Samuel A. Meier performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Columbus.

Mrs. Kohl Hultin, 24, received a master's degree summa cum laude in Hebrew and ancient Near Eastern languages and cultures from Ohio State University earlier this month. She and the bridegroom graduated from Ohio State. Her father is a sculptor and papermaker and a professor of art history at the College of the Desert in Palm Desert, Calif. Her mother is an information assistant in the human resources department at Ohio State, in Columbus. The bride is the stepdaughter of Andrea Von Milbacher-Kohl.

Amber Ruth Kohl, the daughter of Sharon R. Constantinidis of Columbus, Ohio, and William A. Kohl of Aguanga, Calif., was married yesterday to Jeremy Foreman Hultin, a son of Jill and Jerry Hultin of Alexandria, Va. The Rev. Dr. Samuel A. Meier performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church in Columbus.

Mrs. Kohl Hultin, 24, received a master's degree summa cum laude in Hebrew and ancient Near Eastern languages and cultures from Ohio State University earlier this month. She and the bridegroom graduated from Ohio State. Her father is a sculptor and papermaker and a professor of art history at the College of the Desert in Palm Desert, Calif. Her mother is an information assistant in the human resources department at Ohio State, in Columbus. The bride is the stepdaughter of Andrea Von Milbacher-Kohl.

Mr. Hultin, 27, is a doctoral student in religious studies at Yale University. He received a master's degree in New Testament studies from Trinity Evangelical Divinity School. His mother is a vice president of the Jefferson Consulting Group, a lobbying and consulting firm in Washington. His father is the under secretary of the Navy in Washington.
